page.title: 02An old Laceby resident.
page.content: Malcolm Schofield is 50 years old and has lived in Laceby for 45 years.He started Laceby school at 5 and left at 11.His favourite sports were football and cricket.The boys brought some quarter clothing coupons for the football shirts. The only club in Laceby for children was a youth club.Also there was a playing field.The shops included a bicycle shop,cafe,a bakery,a greengrocer and a butchers.There was a church and there was always a church fete. The village has a 'dilly cart' to empty the toilets in.The new road took a lot of traffic out of the village.A new housing estate was built on a farmers field.He said there was a bus service to Laceby.He liked living in Laceby but felt it was too big now.
